references.paper_title: Semi-Supervised Classification with Graph Convolutional Networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational for many graph neural network architectures, and its message-passing paradigm is central to the functioning of Graph Contrastive Learning (GCL).
Graph Attention Networks (GATs) are another important architecture in graph neural networks, and are also used in many GCL approaches.

references.paper_title: A Simple Framework for Contrastive Learning of Visual Representations
references.reason: This paper is highly influential for self-supervised learning in computer vision, and the principles of contrastive learning are fundamental to Graph Contrastive Learning.
This work is highly influential in the field of graph contrastive learning and proposes an important baseline model for graph contrastive learning.

references.paper_title: How Powerful are Graph Neural Networks?
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical analysis of the capabilities of graph neural networks, which is relevant to understanding the potential and limitations of GCL methods.
